page.title: 14HAVERGAL SCHOOL
page.content: This Church of England school was built in l872 and named after Frances Ridley Havergal,the hymnwriter,who lived in the village in the l86Os.Her hymn "Take my life and let it be" has been adopted as the school hymn.The four houses of the school are named after prominent local families,Vernon,Swynnerton, Giffard and Havergal.The school was built to educate children of all ages, but has served as a first school for children of 5 to 9 years since the introduction of the "three-tier system". The catchment area covers a 2 mile radius, but falling school rolls have occasioned a policy change and from Autumn l986 the age range will be 5 to ll years.The older children from Calf Heath and Shareshill are taken by coach to the High School at Cheslyn Hay.
